meanings.definition: The state of being immune or resistant to something.
meanings.sent1: Her insusceptibility to colds kept her healthy all winter.
meanings.sent2: His insusceptibility to peer pressure made him a strong leader.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's insusceptibility to mind control made him the perfect crime fighter.
meanings.sent4: The old castle's insusceptibility to decay was a testament to its sturdy construction.
meanings.sent5: The insusceptibility of the vaccine to spoilage ensured its effectiveness.

meanings.definition: The quality of being not easily affected or influenced by something.
meanings.sent1: The insusceptibility of the rock to erosion made it a lasting monument.
meanings.sent2: Her insusceptibility to distractions allowed her to focus on her studies.
meanings.sent3: The insusceptibility of the cat to catnip puzzled its owner.
meanings.sent4: His insusceptibility to flattery made him a trustworthy friend.
meanings.sent5: The insusceptibility of the old tree to disease made it stand out in the forest.
